ARABIC: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The Day they will emerge swiftly from their graves as if rushing to rally to the flag,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The day when they will come out of their graves in all haste as though rushing to their altars,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: the Day on which they will hastily come forth from their graves, as though they were hurrying on to the altars of their deities.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: the Day when they rush out of their graves as if racing towards a signpost,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: A day when they will come out of the graves in haste, as if rushing towards their goals.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The Day when they will come out of the graves quickly as racing to a Nusub,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The day on which they shall come forth from their graves in haste, as if they were hastening on to a goal,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: the day they shall come forth from the tombs hastily, as if they were hurrying unto a waymark,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The day when they come forth from the graves in haste, as racing to a goal,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: the Day when they shall come out of their graves in haste, as if they were racing to a goal,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The Day whereon they shall come forth from the sepulchres hastily, as though they were to an altar hurrying.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: the day when they emerge from graves, hastening, as if racing toward a target,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The Day whereon they will issue from their sepulchres in sudden haste as if they were rushing to a goal-post (fixed for them),-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The Day when they will come out of the graves quickly as racing to a goal,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: the Day when they shall rush from their graves, as if they were hurrying to a raised flag,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The Day when they will emerge from the tombs in a rush, as though they were hurrying towards a target.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:43] the day when they will come forth from the graves hastening, to the site of the Gathering, as if racing to a [standing] target (nasbin: a variant reading has nusubin, meaning something that has been erected [mansūb], such as a flag or a banner),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Allah then explained when this chastisement will take place, saying: (The day when they come forth from the graves in haste) in response to the sound (as racing to a goal) or a banner,
